sentence.text: In vivo studies of the activity of four of the kinases, KinA, KinC, KinD (ykvD) and KinE (ykrQ), using abrB transcription as an indicator of Spo0A~P level, revealed that ____ and ____ were responsible for _______ production during the exponential phase of growth in the absence of KinA and KinB.

In this mutant, expression of the ______ gene, whose transcription depends on both ________ and the phosphorylated _____ protein, Spo0A~P, a major transcription factor during early stages of sporulation, was greatly reduced at 43 degrees C.
Transcription of ____ was dependent on ____, and the mRNA was detectable from 2 h after the cessation of logarithmic growth (T2 of sporulation).
____ was transcribed by ____ RNA polymerase from T4 of sporulation.
Both ____ and ____ were essential for ____ expression, and this gene was transcribed from T5 of sporulation.

Analysis of the expression of a translational ywhE-lacZ fusion showed that ____ expression is sporulation-specific, and is controlled predominantly by the forespore-specific sigma factor ________, and to a lesser extent by ________.
Secondly, ______ is essential for the activation of the first compartment-specific transcription factor ________ in the prespore.
Localization of ______ was shown to be dependent on the essential cell division protein ____.
In the shaA mutant, ________-dependent expression of _____ and _____ at an early stage of sporulation was sensitive to external NaCl.
The expression of ____ is under the control of both ________ and ________.
Expression of the ________-dependent ____ gene depended on ____.
Our results indicate that the level of ____ level in outgrowing spores depends mainly on _______, because sigB mutants show normal KatX activity in dormant and outgrowing spores.
Therefore, the physiological role of ______-dependent ____ expression remains obscure.
The -10 and -35 sequences of the ______- and ______-dependent promoters of ____ overlap, and the transcriptional start points used by EsigmaB and EsigmaF differ by only one nucleotide.
We demonstrated that ____ is also a ______-dependent general stress gene, since it is strongly induced by heat, salt and ethanol stress, as well as by energy depletion.

Taken together, the results support the idea that sequestration of ______ protein into the prespore plays an important role in the control of ______ activation and in coupling this activation to septation.

______ is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, _______, an anti-anti-sigma factor, _______, and a membrane-bound phosphatase, ______, which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of _______ back to the active form.

The ____ gene of Bacillus subtilis, encoding a catabolic glutamate dehydrogenase, is transcribed by ____-containing RNA polymerase and requires for its expression ____, a member of the NtrC/NifA family of proteins that bind to enhancer-like elements, called upstream activating sequences (UAS).

Unlike the case for other _________-dependent genes, ____ has no UAS; instead, its expression depends on a sequence located 1.5 kilobases downstream of the rocG promoter, beyond the end of the rocG coding region.
Northern blot and primer extension analyses indicated that ____ is transcribed by _________ during sporulation.
These results suggest that ____ may act as a negative regulator for the transcription of ____, ____, ____ and ____.
The first stage, which involves the phosphatase function of ______, depends on the cell division protein ____ and could correspond to the ____-dependent assembly of ______ into E-rings.

Evidence based on the use of modified and mutant forms of the phosphatase protein indicates that ______ blocks the capacity of unphosphorylated _______ to activate ______ until formation of the polar septum is completed.

Cell-specific activation of transcription factor ______ during sporulation in Bacillus subtilis requires the formation of the polar septum and the activity of a serine phosphatase (______) located in the septum.
The ______ phosphatase indirectly activates ______ by dephosphorylating a protein (_________) in the pathway that controls the activity of the transcription factor.
Dephosphorylation of _________ by ______ is strictly dependent on the presence of the bivalent metal ions Mn2+ or Mg2+.
(i) The finding that the _____ operon is under ______ control indicates that the elimination of multidrug compounds might be a new function in multiple stress resistance.

The ____ gene might belong to the increasing number of ______-dependent genes whose orthologues are under the control of sigmas in Escherichia coli, indicating that both regulons may fulfil similar functions.
Three new ______-dependent genes (____, ____ and ____) encoding proteins with still unknown functions were also described.

Cell specificity is first established in the forespore under the control of the _______ factor, which is itself activated through the action of the ______ serine phosphatase, an enzyme targeted to the septum between the two cells.
Most ___ genes, and the ____ gene, are transcribed by ______ RNA polymerase.
Previously, it was shown that the ____ protein inhibits transcription in vitro of the ____ gene encoding sigmaK.
These results demonstrate that ______-dependent transcription of ____ initiates a negative feedback loop in which ____ acts as a repressor to limit production of ______.
A low level of ____ activated transcription of ____ by ______ RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of ____ repressed ____ transcription.
Here, we show that ____ binds near the ____ transcriptional start site, to act as a repressor.
We show that ____ binds to two sites that span the -35 region of the ____ promoter.
These results suggest that a rising level of ____ in sporulating cells may first activate ____ transcription from the upstream site then repress transcription as the downstream site becomes occupied.
____ transcription also requires the DNA binding protein ____.
In contrast, ____ is transcribed in the forespore compartment by RNA polymerase with the forespore-specific ______ and appears to give a monocistronic transcript.
____ negatively controls the transcription of ___ by stimulating the transcription of ____-____, thereby increasing the production of the ____ antisigma factor that inhibits ______ activity.
This stress-induced increase in ____ expression is absolutely dependent on the alternative sigma factor ______, which controls a large stationary-phase and stress regulon.
_______ also contributes to the expression of ____, a putative membrane-bound glucosyl transferase that is partially controlled by the _______ stress response sigma factor.
Transcriptional studies showed that ____ is strongly induced in response to heat, ethanol and salt stress or after starvation for glucose in a _______-dependent manner.
Furthermore, ____ and ____ seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a ________-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via ________.
The expression of the ___ operon was induced by the presence of isoleucine or valine in the growth medium and depended upon the presence of the sigma factor ____, a member of the sigma 54 family.
From these results we conclude that ____ negatively regulates ____ expression by preventing ______-driven transcription of ____, possibly through interaction with the control region.
We have shown previously that the transcription of ____ is driven by an alternative sigma factor, ______.
DNase I footprinting showed that _______ binds strongly to two sites in the ____ promoter region, binds weakly to one site in the ____ promoter, and does not bind specifically to ____.
Transcription of the ____, ____, and ____ genes by final ________ RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called ____.
In vitro transcription experiments suggest that the differential pattern of ___ gene expression results from the combined action of ____ and another transcription factor, _______.
A low concentration of ____ activated ____ transcription by final ________ RNA polymerase, whereas a higher concentration was needed to activate transcription of ____ or ____.
_______ at low concentration repressed ____ transcription, whereas a higher concentration only partially repressed ____ transcription and had little effect on ____ transcription.
A ______-dependent promoter (PW) precedes ____, demonstrating that this transcription factor is positively autoregulated.
The results indicate that ______ is sufficient to repress the transcription of the ____ and ____ promoters and also to activate the transcription of the ____ promoter.
Transcriptional studies demonstrated that the expression from the ____ promoter is induced by L-arabinose, repressed by glucose, and negatively regulated by ____.
During endospore formation in Bacillus subtilis, the DNA binding protein ____ stimulates transcription from several promoters that are used by RNA polymerase containing ______
____ binds to a site on one of these promoters, ____, that overlaps its -35 region.

The ______-dependent promoter drives expression of ____ under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a ______-dependent promoter is responsible for ____ transcription following amino acid limitation.
This indicates that the ____ gene product, being a member of both the ______ and ______ regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the ______ regulon.
In addition to the typical ______-dependent, stress- and starvation-inducible pattern, ____ is also induced in response to amino acid depletion.

The addition of ____ to in vitro transcription reactions resulted in the stimulation of RNAP holoenzyme activity, but ______-RNAP was observed to be more sensitive to ____-dependent stimulation than ______-RNAP.

Although _____ is transcriptionally regulated by the key regulatory device that controls sporulation initiation, the ____ phosphorelay, there is considerable evidence implicating a mechanism of post-translational control that governs the activity and concentration of sigmaH.

The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; ____, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor ________; _______, which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, _______ and _______, of Bacillus subtilis; ____ of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor _______; and ____, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor ________.
Finally, we show that proper localization of SpoIVA required the expression of one or more genes which, like ______, are under the control of the mother cell transcription factor ______.

The _______ regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (_____) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (____), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (____), flotillin (____), ABC transporters (______), non-haem bromoperoxidase (____), epoxide hydrolase (____) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
